intro: Anthenantia lanata, commonly known as the woolly anthenantia, is a flowering plant characterized by its dense, white, woolly covering on its stems and leaves. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early summer, and its leaves are typically broad and lance-shaped. Anthenantia lanata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
